StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential, incident cardiovascular outcomes, and statin therapy among people living with HIV in REPRIEVE

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The REPRIEVE Study is supported by NIH/NHLBI (U01HL123336; U01HL123339), the Office of Aids Research, Kowa Pharmaceuticals America, Inc. (119127), Gilead Sciences, Inc. (CO-US-311-1787), and ViiV Healthcare. Funding for whole exome sequencing was provided by R01HL151283. The study investigators thank the study participants, site investigators and staff, and study-associated personnel for their ongoing participation in the trial. Publications resulting from this data should cite: “Steven K. Grinspoon, MD, a Kathleen V. Fitch, MSN, Edgar Turner Overton, MD, et al. Rationale and design of the Randomized Trial to Prevent Vascular Events in HIV (REPRIEVE). American Heart Journal 212: 23-35, 2019. The original data can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Cardiovascular Disease and/or HIV. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cardiovascular Disease and/or Human Immunodeficiency Virus, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CVD-HIV-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Cardiovascular Disease and/or Human Immunodeficiency Virus. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
